definition: to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances

sentences.english: It is also reflection that we like or hate a person.
sentences.chinese: 我們喜歡或惱恨對方，也是反射作用。

sentences.english: Do you love drunk driving but hate spending the night in the slammer?
sentences.chinese: 你是否喜歡酒後駕車兜風但是惱恨在班房裏過夜？

sentences.english: Woe to the Assyrian, the rod of my anger, in whose hand is the club of my wrath!
sentences.chinese: 亞述是我怒氣的棍，手中拿我惱恨的杖。

sentences.english: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 與衆寡合的，獨自尋求心願，並惱恨一切真智慧。

sentences.english: O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation.
sentences.chinese: 亞述是我怒氣的棍，手中拿我惱恨的仗。

sentences.english: Asa was angry with the seer because of this; he was so enraged that he put him in prison.
sentences.chinese: 亞撒因此惱恨先見，將他囚在監裏。

sentences.english: Don't hhadvertising your enemy. or you will make wrong judgment.
sentences.chinese: 不要惱恨你的敵人，否則你將做出舛錯的判決。

sentences.english: Wonder not, brethren, if the world hate you.
sentences.chinese: 弟兄們，如果世界惱恨你們，不必驚奇。

definition: to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
